intro: Adenophorus abietinus, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to the high altitudes of the European Alps and other mountainous regions of Europe. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with succulent, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, typically displaying white or pale blue petals. Adenophorus abietinus is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
